body:
## Automated Fix
**Problem**: Missing Flyweight Pattern
**Category**: Architecture
**Severity**: Medium
**Confidence**: 0.80 (High Confidence)

### Explanation
Implemented the Flyweight pattern in `src/tarpit/labyrinth.py` to optimize memory usage when generating labyrinth pages. The previous implementation created new `a` tag strings for each link, which can be memory-intensive when generating many pages or pages with a high depth. The Flyweight pattern addresses this by sharing the intrinsic state (the static parts of the `a` tag) among multiple objects, while the extrinsic state (the specific link) is passed as a parameter.  A shared `a` tag flyweight is created and reused for each link, significantly reducing memory overhead.

### Verification
Auto-generated fix. Please review carefully.

Fixes #635
title: [Architecture] [Medium] Missing Flyweight Pattern
